message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public void snake() {
    snake.add(new Snake(ball.getX(), ball.getY()));
    currentTime++;
    Iterator<Snake> it = snake.iterator();
    while(it.hasNext()){
        Snake currentSnake = it.next();
        if(currentSnake.creationDate < SnakeLength){
            currentSnake.Update();
        } else {
            Gdx.app.log("SnakeLength" + SnakeLength, "CreationDate" + currentSnake.creationDate);
            it.remove();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you're trying to remove an item from a list while iterating over it using a for-each loop, which is not allowed in Java. Instead, you should use an Iterator's remove method, which safely removes the current element from the underlying collection.
